case_vignette: An 8-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his foster mother because of complaints from his teachers regarding poor performance at school for the past 8 months! He does not listen to their instructions, often talks during class, and rarely completes his school assignments! He does not sit in his seat in the classroom and often cuts in line at the cafeteria! His foster mother reports that he runs around a lot inside the house and refuses to help his sister with chores and errands! He frequently interrupts his foster mother's conversations with others and talks excessively! She has found him trying to climb on the roof on multiple occasions! He was placed in foster care because of neglect by his biological parents 3 years ago! Physical examination shows no abnormalities! Neurologic examination shows no focal findings! Mental status examination shows a neutral affect!
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having trouble listening to instructions, talking a lot during class, and not finishing my school assignments.
How old are you?
I am 8 years old.
Do these behaviors occur both at home and in school?
Yes, these behaviors occur both at home and in school.
Have you noticed if these behaviors are affecting your social interactions or friendships?
Yes, my behaviors are affecting my social interactions and friendships.
Have these issues been ongoing and did they occur before the age of 12?
Yes, these issues have been ongoing for the past 8 months and they started before the age of 12.
Does your family have a history of ADHD or any related disorders?
I'm not aware of my biological family's medical history because I was placed in foster care due to neglect.
Final Diagnosis: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)

trial_0.singleturn_frq: Final Diagnosis: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
trial_0.summarized_conversation: A child, aged 8, has been experiencing difficulties in listening to instructions, talking excessively during class, and failing to complete school assignments. These behavioral issues extend to both the home and school environments. Furthermore, they are adversely affecting the child's social interactions and friendships. The problems have persisted for the past 8 months and onset was before the age of 12. The child was placed in foster care due to neglect and has no knowledge of their biological family's medical history.
